title: LAST-LEG IMPAIRED DRIVING FACTS
facts: Driving under the influence of alcohol or drugs remains a persistent highway safety issue, causing over 10,000 deaths annually in the U.S.
Approximately half of intoxicated drivers arrested for DUI report having had their last drink at a licensed bar or restaurant.
Late-night public transit helps reduce impaired driving in urban cores, but the benefit can be offset by "spatial shifting" of risk to suburban areas.
The Evesham Saves Lives rideshare program was associated with an 18% reduction in overall injury crashes and a 38% reduction in nighttime crashes.
